revised_title: Induced Melanism in Lepidoptera: Experiments with Lead and Manganese
tldr: Researchers conducted experiments to induce melanism in the moth Selenia bilunaria by feeding larvae lead and manganese salts. The experiments showed that the induced melanistic traits were inherited in subsequent generations. This study aimed to understand the occurrence of melanism in Lepidoptera species in industrial areas where plants might be contaminated with metallic fumes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
